title: Sales Development Representative Intern
content:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Snowflake is a leading data cloud platform that enables organizations to mobilize their data to drive insights and make better business decisions. With a highly scalable and secure architecture, Snowflake empowers businesses to unify and analyze their data in real-time, facilitating data-driven strategies across various industries. Join Snowflake's dynamic team and contribute to revolutionizing the way data is utilized in the modern world.Duration: 12 weeks
Location: San Mateo, CA; Denver, CO; Bellevue, WA; Atlanta, GA
Overview: We’re looking for dedicated students and career-shifting professionals who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake. As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) Intern at Snowflake, you will have the opportunity to be an integral part of our fast-paced sales team. You will work closely with experienced SDRs and SDR Managers to develop critical sales skills and support our lead generation efforts. This internship is an excellent stepping stone for individuals interested in pursuing a career in sales, business development, or technology-related fields. Throughout the internship, you will gain hands-on experience, learn best practices in sales, and play a vital role in expanding Snowflake's customer base, in addition to gaining an understanding of how B2B companies build and expand. Our mission is to provide you the most valuable early career experience in the technology industry.
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate with the Sales Development team to identify and qualify potential leads and prospects within the target market.
Conduct outbound prospecting activities through cold calling, email campaigns, and social media to initiate conversations with potential customers.
Articulate the value proposition of Snowflake's data cloud platform to potential clients, generating interest and setting up introductory meetings for the sales team.
Leverage sales tools and technologies to track and manage prospecting activities, ensuring accurate and up-to-date records in the CRM system.
Research and gather information on potential customers, understanding their business needs and challenges to customize outreach strategies effectively.
Learn and adapt to various sales methodologies, refining your communication and persuasion skills.
Collaborate with marketing teams to support campaigns and promotions, ensuring consistent messaging across all channels.
Engage in regular training sessions to enhance product knowledge, industry trends, and sales techniques.
Provide feedback to the sales team and contribute ideas to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the sales development process.

REQUIREMENTS:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with an ability to engage prospects and clients professionally.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport quickly and effectively.
High problem-solving ability to learn quickly in a dynamic environment with a demonstration of organizing and working with data
A high-energy self-starter with a proactive attitude and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Interest in technology and a willingness to learn about Snowflake's data cloud platform and the data industry.
Prior experience in sales, customer service, or related fields is a plus but not required.
Proficiency in using standard office tools and familiarity with CRM systems is advantageous.
If currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program, you are in your Junior or Senior year.

BENEFITS:

Paid internships in the heart of the software industry with post-internship career opportunities (full-time and/or additional internships)
Gain valuable hands-on experience in a high-growth, fast-paced, fun and inclusive technology company.
Work closely with experienced professionals and world-class experts who will mentor and guide your career development.
Opportunity to contribute ideas and meaningful contributions in order to make a real impact on the growth of Snowflake's customer base.
Competitive compensation and potential future career opportunities within the organization.
High-level access to training programs, resources, and supervisors (manager and mentor) to provide feedback throughout your internship and enhance your sales and business development skills.

How to Apply: To apply for the Sales Development Representative (SDR) Internship at Snowflake, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your interest in the role and why you believe you would be a valuable addition to our team. We look forward to reviewing your application and discovering how you can contribute to Snowflake's success.
Note: The specific details, duration, and requirements of the internship may vary.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

values.label: I do not want to answer
No, I do not have a disability and have not had one in the past
Yes, I have a disability, or have had one in the past
I identify as one or more of the classifications of a protected veteran
I am not a protected veteran
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

questions.label: Where have you most recently worked?
Have you worked at Snowflake in the past in a Full-time, Part-time, contractor or Intern capacity?
For Snowflake to anticipate possible immigration timelines and obligations, could you confirm you are currently authorized to work in the country to which you are applying?

Will you require sponsorship to continue or extend your current work authorization status, either now or in the future (Example – including but not limited to: work permits such as H-1B in the United States, Highly Skilled Migrant in the Netherlands or a Blue Card in Poland or Germany. This could also include change of sponsorship from your current employer to Snowflake)?
A “U.S. person” is a citizen, legal permanent resident, or legal temporary resident (i.e., a refugee or asylee) of the United States. Which of the following best describes your “U.S. person” status?

values.label: I am a citizen of Cuba, Iran, North Korea, or Syria AND I am NOT a U.S. person.
None of the above; I am a citizen of a different country.

questions.label: [US Applicants Only] Are you subject to any post-employment restrictions based on your role as a government (federal, state, local, or otherwise) employee or contractor, including representational restrictions or restrictions arising from work on a government procurement?
Due to SEC auditor independence requirements, please let us know whether you have previously worked at, or if currently working at PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), who is our independent auditor.

values.label: Yes - I have previously worked at, or is currently working at PwC.
No - I have never been employed by PwC.

questions.description: When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Snowflake. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Snowflake’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Snowflake, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Snowflake will share your personal data with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Snowflake to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Snowflake’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site and such transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses as approved by the European Union Commission and/or the Privacy Shield framework. Further information about how Snowflake processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Notice (the term “privacy notice” to be a link to our privacy notice located at https://www.snowflake.com/privacy-policy/ ). Your personal data will be retained by Snowflake as long as we determine it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. You have the right to data portability, to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. Such requests can be made by contacting us at privacy@snowflake.com.
questions.label: Point of Data Transfer
Please provide the name of the school where you’re currently enrolled.
Please confirm the full name of the study program and the degree you are currently enrolled.
Please provide your anticipated graduation date.
Please confirm the number of hours per week you can work and be present in the office location specified in the job description (full-time is 40 hours per week).

For the location specified in the JD, do you require immigration sponsorship to establish, continue, or extend your current work authorization status, either now or in the future? (For example – this may be J1, TN, F1, Schengen visa type C or D, student residence permit, etc. This may be sponsorship you have already arranged, or sponsorship via Snowflake or your school.) Please indicate YES if you have or need any immigration sponsorship, or if you are unsure.
If yes, you will receive a follow-up checklist where you can input detailed information pertaining to your currently held visa and/or additional visa needs.
